description: Comprehensive test cases for SHIM Score (Sexual Health Inventory for Men) Calculator

testCases.name: Severe ED - Minimum Score (5)

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Severe erectile dysfunction. Comprehensive medical evaluation recommended to identify underlying causes. Multiple treatment options should be explored.

testCases.notes: All questions at minimum (1 point each)

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Severe erectile dysfunction. Comprehensive medical evaluation recommended to identify underlying causes. Multiple treatment options should be explored.
Severe erectile dysfunction. Comprehensive medical evaluation recommended to identify underlying causes. Multiple treatment options should be explored.
Moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation recommended. Treatment with PDE5 inhibitors or other therapies should be considered.
Moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation recommended. Treatment with PDE5 inhibitors or other therapies should be considered.
Moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation recommended. Treatment with PDE5 inhibitors or other therapies should be considered.
Mild-to-moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation and treatment options should be discussed. PDE5 inhibitors are often effective.
Mild-to-moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation and treatment options should be discussed. PDE5 inhibitors are often effective.
Mild-to-moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation and treatment options should be discussed. PDE5 inhibitors are often effective.
Mild erectile dysfunction. Consider lifestyle modifications and counseling. Medical treatment may be beneficial if desired.
Mild erectile dysfunction. Consider lifestyle modifications and counseling. Medical treatment may be beneficial if desired.
Mild erectile dysfunction. Consider lifestyle modifications and counseling. Medical treatment may be beneficial if desired.
No evidence of erectile dysfunction. Erectile function is normal.
No evidence of erectile dysfunction. Erectile function is normal.

testCases.name: No ED - Maximum Score (25)

expected.Clinical Interpretation: No evidence of erectile dysfunction. Erectile function is normal.

testCases.notes: Perfect score - all questions at maximum (5 points each)

testCases.name: No Sexual Activity - Score with zeros

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Severe erectile dysfunction (may include no sexual activity). Comprehensive medical evaluation recommended. Consider cardiovascular and endocrine assessment as clinically indicated.

testCases.notes: Tests questions 2-5 with 'no sexual activity' responses (0 points)

testCases.name: Mixed Responses - Q1 high, others low

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation recommended. Treatment with PDE5 inhibitors or other therapies should be considered.

testCases.notes: High confidence but poor performance - tests individual question scoring

testCases.name: Mixed Responses - Varied across all questions

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Mild-to-moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation and treatment options should be discussed. PDE5 inhibitors are often effective.

testCases.name: Critical Boundary Test - 7 vs 8

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation recommended. Treatment with PDE5 inhibitors or other therapies should be considered.

testCases.notes: Tests critical boundary between Severe and Moderate ED

testCases.name: Critical Boundary Test - 11 vs 12

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Mild-to-moderate erectile dysfunction. Medical evaluation and treatment options should be discussed. PDE5 inhibitors are often effective.

testCases.notes: Tests critical boundary between Moderate and Mild-to-Moderate ED

testCases.name: Critical Boundary Test - 16 vs 17

expected.Clinical Interpretation: Mild erectile dysfunction. Consider lifestyle modifications and counseling. Medical treatment may be beneficial if desired.

testCases.notes: Tests critical boundary between Mild-to-Moderate and Mild ED

testCases.name: Critical Boundary Test - 21 vs 22

expected.Clinical Interpretation: No evidence of erectile dysfunction. Erectile function is normal.

testCases.notes: Tests critical boundary between Mild ED and No ED - most clinically significant threshold
